title: Kim Kold
text:
Kim Kold (born 25 August 1965) is a Danish actor and former professional <a href="bodybuilder">bodybuilder</a>. Standing 6'4" (1.93 m) tall and weighing 320 lbs (155 kg), he is primarily known for his role as Owen Shaw's crew member Klaus in <a href="Fast%20%26amp%3B%20Furious%206">Fast & Furious 6</a>.
Early life.
Born in <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>, Kold played around 150 <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches as a <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> in the lower leagues until he suffered from an injury at the age of 27. He was sent to the gym for rehabilitation training, where he took up an interest in <a href="bodybuilding">bodybuilding</a>.
Career.
Bodybuilding.
Kold started competing in 1997. He won the Danish National Bodybuilding Championship in 2006.
Acting.
Kold was persuaded by his friend, film director <a href="Mads%20Matthiesen">Mads Matthiesen</a>, to play the title role in Matthiesen's <a href="short%20film">short film</a> "Dennis" (2007). The film was not promoted, but soon became popular and made Kold a name as an actor. He reprised the role of Dennis when Matthiesen made "<a href="Teddy%20Bear%20%282012%20film%29">Teddy Bear</a>" (2012), a feature-length adaptation of "Dennis". He appeared in "<a href="Fast%20%26amp%3B%20Furious%206">Fast & Furious 6</a>" (2013), as well as Polish short film "Smok" (2015), based on the legend of <a href="Wawel%20Dragon">Wawel Dragon</a>. In 2016 he appeared the film "<a href="Star%20Trek%20Beyond">Star Trek Beyond</a>" as well as the film "<a href="6%20Underground%20%28film%29">6 Underground</a>" in 2019.
Other ventures.
Kold worked as a <a href="Locksmithing">locksmith</a> in <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a> for several years during his bodybuilding career. He owns his own security business in <a href="Puerto%20Ban%C3%BAs">Puerto Banús</a>.
